text:
Can I ask for your lattice dye alignment experiences?

I'm about to get some more FITC (what 3i gave us years ago) for dye alignment.  Is that the best option?  Do other dyes 'stick' less?  What concentrations of which dye do you use?  Do you by chance have a catalog number?  How did you measure the solution concentration (or other related protocols)?

Any dye align info you might have would be great to know.  I kinda like the idea of a wiki for light sheet core staff.  It'll have an overlap and purpose for core users, but it would be great to have all these nuggets of info in one place :slightly_smiling_face:

Any dye align info you might have would be great to know.  I kinda like the idea of a wiki for light sheet core staff.  It'll have an overlap and purpose for core users, but it would be great to have all these nuggets of info in one place

text: Would love to know more about the weird optic they have in between the two lenses.

elements.text: Would love to know more about the weird optic they have in between the two lenses.

text:
I use atto647 exclusively, diluted to 1:100 (I think can check tomorrow) from whatever stock 3i gave me and then 200ul ish (never actually measure) of that in the 10ml bath. I find this really helpful because for trial experiments with GFP labeled stuff you can leave it in there without it bothering things too much.
I’m intending to record an alignment tutorial video, primarily as a training tool for Warwick but happy to make it available.
Day to day my saving time hack is that media for cells like L15 + FBS is autofluorescent enough under 488nm to do a sufficient dye alignment without adding anything else.

text: I think dragging Reto, Kevin Dean, Doug Shepperd and Jon Daniels into this group could get you a better answer and maybe inviting Daniel Von Waggenheim.
